reviews.review_text: One of the most authentic Thai restaurants in town offering a wide selection of original recipes/ dishes. The restaurant is small and the servers, albeit being friendly, were not the most accommodating. We asked for crushed peanuts for our papaya salad and they gave us a mere half a teaspoon. The other times we ate here before, they have served peanuts with the papaya salad, which is how we prefer it. We would be ok if get charged extra for this too. Our friend also ordered Thai coffee which came with ice and we asked if we could get another one but with no ice, and they said no   For this reason, I m rating their service a 3/5 despite their politeness. But I d go back for the food in a heartbeat!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Natasha, Thank you for giving us five stars. Even if you are not satisfied with our service. We would like to explain what happened. The first is peanuts. You all ordered papaya salad. And your boyfriend has asked for peanuts for it but in the recipe we dont have it on the menu. which we have given You go for a small cup of peanuts. and you have asked for more which we have refused Because it is something that is not in the recipe. 2. For iced coffee The shop is sure that we can make iced coffee without ice. But that day you asked us to make hot coffee for you. It wasnt on the menu so we declined. However, I think there has been a misunderstanding in this communication. and the shop would like to inform you that In fact, the shop has announced that they will do take out only from September 5th. Thank you very much.

reviews.review_text: Probably the best pad see yew I ve had in central Vancouver yet. The rice noodles were delightfully flavorful with much dimension. The pork was crispy and well cooked. It s a tad expensive but it was a great portion size and came out fairly fast. Service was great - very fast and responsive. It s a little hole in the wall, and better to take to go.

One of the best Thai restaurants Ive been to so far. We ordered the Pad Si Ew Moo Grob (rice sheet noodles with crispy pork) and Chuchi Pla Tod (creamy coconut curry with crispy basa fillets). Both were so much more flavourful than I expected, and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality and presentation. The basa fillets and pork were perfectly crispy. Id definitely recommend both dishes, though if I had to pick a must-try item, itd be the Chuchi Pla Tod for sure. The place is small with little seating and an open kitchen. I came in the summer and there wasnt much foot traffic, so sitting outside was actually enjoyable. The waitress came out to check in on us quite often (most of their customers seem to sit outside) and refilled our water frequently. Its about $25-$35 per person, which is on the higher end of price, but was so worth it for the food, quantity was decent too. I would definitely recommend and will be back myself to show this place to other friends.

So delicious Pad Si Ew Moo Grob !!! Rice sheet noodles stir-fried with crispy pork, gai lan, egg and white onions. Iced Thai Milk Tea is great too. Overall, feels pretty authentic Thai food. Will definitely visit here again or take out.

Most flavourful Thai food Ive ever had. I know pork blood soup doesnt sound too appetizing, at least not to me, but I had to try it considering the hype and am so glad that I did. Highly recommend! The green curry is next level, its green curry that Ive had countless times before, but they just do it so much better than everything Ive had. I cant wait to go back there to try other items.

Some of the best Thai food that I ve ever had, tried a few things and all of them were outstanding, especially the ones that we got crab / prawns with. The prawns are ginormous here and cooked perfectly. I can t wait to go back and try some more of their dishes. Everything feels very traditional and made with care. They only have three tables inside for seating, so it s more of a take out spot. But if I lived close to here I d order regularly for sure. The staff is all very passionate and it shows through their food too.

The best Thai food in Vancouver! Take out only, but everything is packaged very well to go - for my Chuchi Pla Tod had the fish, curry, and rice/veggies all packaged separately so everything was as fresh as possible when I got home to eat it and nothing was soggy. The Pad See Ew is also a favourite - chewy noodles, great flavour. The roti is on the sweeter side, I think its better as a dessert (with condensed milk) than an appetizer (with curry). There are a couple of tables outside to sit at, but its limited, so best to take the food to-go. Cant wait to try more dishes!

Ordered roti with curry sauce, pad thai shrimp, and ka na mu grob (rice with crispy pork). The food was amazing! This is my second time ordering thai food from here, and they never disappoint! We really enjoyed every bite!

This place is phenomenal. I came here with a friend who had just recently visited Thailand, and she kept on saying how authentic their taste is throughout our meal! I had the tom yum soup and it was absolutely DELICIOUS. I haven t enjoyed a bowl of food to that degree in a while. I was floored by the punch of flavors and the quality of its ingredients, from the broth to the mushrooms to the eggs, everything was perfect. Prices are higher than expected for a Thai restaurant, but it is absolutely worth it for a true quality  taste of Thailand. The staff are friendly and the smells are delicious. Please keep in mind that they have very limited seating inside the small restaurant!

My goodness, the food here is incredible. Maybe the biggest black tiger prawns Ive ever encountered? And all the dishes full of flavour and authentically spicy Most of our dishes were served in takeaway pots, but if youre only after white cloth service youre sorely missing out

Gem of a spot where you dont go for atmosphere and esthetics. You come here for authenticity and quality of food. Rice to noodle option for this Thai spot, which ranges from $19-$25. Orders are taken up front before you can have a seat (very limited seating and many people choose takeout instead) and made fresh to order. The kitchen is all visible and open. Flavours are not western style where it is doused with sauce - but still remains packed with flavour. There is no bad choice here - definitely recommend coming here for a no frills but quality food spot.

This is the first must try Thai restaurant. Though it is kind of a street food type kitchen shop. But the food is awesome authentic street food tasty. Unbelievably tasteful. We ordered the fried chicken is crispy from start to end, and the boat noodle is another must try signature bowl. It is hard to describe how tasty it is. I will definitely comeback.

If you are looking for authentic and delicious Thai food, look no further. Generous portions for the price. I always get takeout from here and have never been disappointed before. Quality ingredients too! I m so glad to see they offer real crab instead of imitation unlike other places. I wish they also offered duck too as a protein option.

Pad SI EW was amazing! Crab meat fried rice is less flavorful, regular thai fried rice looks better! The chicken wing sold out before 6pm, so we tried the deep fried pork appetizer, it s tasty as well, would recommend order without the sticky rice.

Very busy with limited seating having just returned. You need to order and pay at the register before sitting. The smell of the cooking is divine, since the seats are adjacent to the kitchen. Most people grab takeout rather than dine in. Our food was served in takeout containers even though we dined in, but Im not sure if that was due to their recent return to dine in service or because we sat down late in the evening. Theyve got a great menu selection that has more unique dishes than some other Thai places, such as the Pad Ki Mao dishes, which use a chewy, clear, and wider rice sheet noodle that has a great bounce on the teeth.

Delicious Pad See ew! The crispy pork was so well done. The staff are friendly and accommodating. There are four small two-person tables for dine-in, so if you are a group of 4 it may make sense to call ahead so they can reserve it for you (and add two tables together) A warning to vegetarians, my friend asked for vegetarian pad see ew and even though it came out with tofu as a substitute, she found there was a lingering pork taste in her noodles that she could not stomach :( She did not end up eating her dish because of this. Vegetarian options: A warning to vegetarians, my friend asked for vegetarian pad see ew and even though it came out with tofu as a substitute, she found there was a lingering pork taste in her noodles that she could not stomach :( She did not end up eating her dish because of this.
This place is such a hidden gem, right under our noses in Kits. Some of the better thai food Ive had outside of Thailand. No frills, all taste

A hidden gem   for sure!! A tiny hole in the wall restaurant that has just enough room to seat 8. Their decor is nothing fancy, but the food is authentic and delicious. They definately do real Thai spice, so if you arent good with heat, tell them ahead of time so they can tone it down for you. First time today, but definately going to become a regular!

I have been searching for a great Thai restaurant for a while and finally I found it. I enjoyed every single bites of the food. The boat noodles was so unique and flavourful! It brought me back to Thailand immediately. They have limited seats inside of restaurant, but they do have a lot of take out orders.

I had been desperately looking for Thai boat noodles in Vancouver before I discovered this spot. The flavours of their boat noodle soup was so vibrant and balanced. Truly a sublime bowl of noodles. Their crispy deep fried wings while not as flavourful as Phnom Penh s, they are well prepared and tasty. Can t wait to eat my way throughout the menu.

This unassuming little place has served me some of the best Thai food I ve had in Vancouver. They charge a premium compared to other family run Thai places, but their dishes are always well made and memorable. Great roti, fantastic Pad Kee Mao, and solid curry.

This restaurant was Authentic Thai cuisine.The owner, chef are Thai.Good warm service, Taste like authentic Thai cuisine as I eat at my home town(Bangkok Thailand).The boat noodle with blood(Nahm tok) was very good.(I recommend this menu). Khao Soi Curry(Northen style noodle) was good but for me it was lightly in taste.Rotee with condensed milk was very good, very crispy.Deconstruction Mango Sticky rice was good combination between fresh mango, mango and coconut ice cream, with sticky rice and crumble.I m Thai and I recommend this restaurant.

Ordered from Ubereats but really want to visit in person now. I loved the Kuai Tiao Khyber Kai. It was so flavourful and herbaceous, and the rice sheets were so interesting in texture - like really thick glass noodles. The crab curry was also really good. Ample amounts of seafood, so the higher prices felt justified. Huge portions, and just packed really well.

Came by for a quick lunch. Had the pork jowl with tamarind sauce with a bit of salad and some chicken wings. Both are very flavorful/savory. You can eat inside but theres a pretty strong fish sauce smell, so if you are wearing nice clothes, Id recommend eating outside.

This is the very few Thai restaurant where you can find Boat Noodles, its very rich and flavourful, might not be for everyone but I like it. The curry is good too, roti and deep fried fish are so very crispy
It is a small restaurant but the portions of main dishes are very big and tasty! I tried the classic Pad Thai and the Roti with condensed milk was delicious. Fast and friendly service! I recommend it
one of the best tom yum soup in Vancouver. Portion is good and shrimps are delicious.

Ordered delivery from Unchai for the first time and was very impressed. Perfect level of spice and balance of flavour in every dish. The roti very crispy despite being delayed due to delivery, the curry was flavourful yet light. Would highly recommend!
Nice little place, not widely known but food is full of flavor and packs a real punch. More spicy and more legit, great for quick takeouts, highly recommend if you need your snack attack satisfied!

Unchai Thai restaurant is a hidden gem. Tried their boat noodle (                 ) for the very first time yesterday and it was amazing. Just like in Thailand!!! Staff are super friendly and cheerful. Will definitely be back. Highly recoommended.

This is so good. I m Thai and when I miss Thai boat noodle. I always com here. I think the taste is very similar to original one. But the original in Thailand is very small dish and cost about 1 cad. If you visit Bangkok you have to try Thai Boat Noodle.

Found a gem while walking around Kits! Finally found authentic and damn delicious Thai food! Had their Thai omelette with crab meat and Pad Si Ew. Flavours were on point! Will definitely go back and try other dishes.

Unbelievable Thai food at a small restaurant. A couple blocks from home, my girlfriend and I were excited to try this place after a recommendation from my co worker. The menu is not super long, but had everything I wanted. We ended up getting the roti and curry and crispy chicken wings for appetizers. Both were amazing and to die for. Super crispy chicken skin. For mains, we got the green prawn curry which blue my mind and then tofu pad Thai. You need to come here as soon as possible. It is the same quality as Maenam, just with a more classic Thai cuisine. Very reasonably priced too.

Soo good! And very affordable. This is the best Thai meal Ive had in a long time. I really like that Unchai has the salty and spicy chili sauce if you ask for it. The owners are cooking and serving the food and they were absolutely lovely. Great service and delicious food. It would be great to see them add to the menu in the future. I love a good yellow curry and would be so happy if there was a place in Vancouver where I could get a banana roti. Definitely try this place out. Its fantastic.
Incredible Thai food. If you haven t been you really gotta go. Try the pad ga pao with moo grob! The portions are very generous and the quality is off the charts!

THE BEST PAD SEE EW IN VANCOUVER!!! No joke these noodles are the thickest most delicious noodles Ive ever tasted, and Ive tried alot of different Thai restaurants. These by far beat all the rest. Only doing take out now since the pandemic, but that doesnt matter as the beach isnt far away so just take it down to the beach to enjoy it :)
Fantastic Thai kitchen. Incredible textures and flavours, high quality ingredients - and lots of them. Extremely fair prices. Lots of variety available.

This hole-in-the-wall is an absolute gem! Easily some of the best Thai food in Vancouver. Bold flavours, traditional preparation, unique ingredients, and homemade sauces. Great choice for work lunch, casual dinner and take out!
Hands down the best Thai food I have ever had!  Chef is a true talent, ingredients are always fresh and tasty.  Ill go back to this restaurant time and time again.  Well priced for such quality food
Delicious and authentic neighborhood Thai spot. You can eat on the streetside patio but its definitely a hot takeaway spot in the area and I can see why.
Amazing broth and reasonable price Rich flavour but I don t have any thirsty feeling after finishing the whole soup.
Been meaning to come to this place for a while and it didnt disappoint. These people were hustling, I really wish they would expand so there would be more room for seating!
Solid Thai food.  Knew it was solid the second I sipped their Thai ice tea.  Had the pad Thai and duck noodles.  Owner served up 3 sauces kept in the coolers, which were excellent!

Its difficult to find Thai Boat Noodles (and I live in New York City), so whenever I find them, I get them!  These were delicious!  Very small space, most orders are likely takeout.  Even so, I got a small table and enjoyed a delicious lunch here.
I had live in Thailand for 10 yrs, this is amazing Thai restaurant, its even better than you can get in Thailand.

One of the best Thai restaurants Ive been to in the city. The food is rich with flavour and there are often new items added to the menu. The gang kua curries are my favourite. Prices have increased slowly over the years but its well worth it.

Standouts were both of the soup noodles:  Boat Noodle and Tom Yum Goong.  We havent tasted authentic Thai flavors since being in that country ten years ago.  This is a small place with maybe total seating capacity of 8 people but seems to thriving with take-out orders.
Definitely the best restaurant Thai food I have had in North America.

Love getting take out here. Best Thai I ve had in the city, plus they have unique dishes you don t see on most menus. Service is fairly fast. Quality is consistent. Flavours are packed with savoury, umami, sour, spicy goodness. Textures are on point with perfectly cooked noodles, crunchy toppings, and refreshing bites from the veggies. Try the boat noodles and glass noodle dishes. They re so good, I get them every time.
So delicious, good portion sizes, nice packaging, and quick. Tastes authentic.

AWESOME!! This restaurant serves great Laotian food. Everything tasted amazing! We love spicy-hot food and the server made great suggestions per our palate! Enjoyable food! Our favorites and repeat orders for the night were the Khaw Kling with Shrimp and Roti with curry sauce. The green curry was awesome! The pork salad was incredibly delicious, so were the pad-kee-mao plates. Fantastic food!! We were a group of 7 and werent great fans of sitting out on the street side tables, so well just do take-out next time. But the food surely made up for the seating inconvenience.
Nice people nice food. Try the new dish of curry prawn. Definitely will go back and try the boat noodles!
A hole in the wall thats too good to pass up! Hubby had unchai curry which was great. I FINALLY found, after years of searching, someone who makes Khao Soi, which was FANTASTIC

You wouldnt guess from the outside that this tiny little place bangs out such a great quality of food. Very authentic Thai quisine for very affordable prices and amazing customer service. Highly recommended.
Pad Ga Pao pork jowl was amazing

Tiny place with delicious rice noodles. Note that from Sep 5 they will only do take out. Vegetarian options: They can make some of the dishes vegetarian, this is not clear on the menu but if you ask they will tell you which ones.

Ok as someone who been to Thailand many many times I must say the food is very good close to what youd get in Thailand, not totally authentic but quite close. The only thing is i find the food kinda overpriced, basically minimum 20 for a rice or noodle dish, BUT they do put a good amount of meat in every dish, which  sort of justify the price.. Also there is only 2 smalls tables indoor and 3 tables outside.
Small business with open kitchen. Great service, great portions and great taste. Everything was freshly made in front of us. Couldn t ask for more!

Authentic food, and atmosphere. If youve ever been to Bangkok, eating next to food trolleys, this place will make you happy and miss BKK Parking: Park around the corner on the residential streets - not difficult.
Excellent food. Everything was packed with flavour, and we got the food fairly quickly as well.
Great little Thai place with authentic food, and very friendly service. Love this place for lunch, but because they only have very few tables best order pick - up.

Ordered boat noodle, shrimp salad, curry and their new offering of hoi jo (crab meat & shrimp rolls). Hoi jo was tasty and the dipping sauce was excellent. Curry doesnt taste like usual Thai restaurants offering. Boat noodle with beef was to die for! Shrimps of shrimp salad were blanched to perfection. Look forward to the next visit!
Really incredible food and authentic experience. I will say though that at times we were coughing due to not great ventilation and the frying of hot chilies! Would recommend for takeout over dine in!
Best Thai food Ive had in the lower mainland to date. The Gang Kua shrimp is incredible; so flavorful and creamy. I plan on going back to try every other menu item eventually.
The food and service here was very good! Definitely would recommend!

I live around the corner from this place and this will become a regular stop for me. It was absolutely incredible with such amazing, real Thai flavours. The best Thai food I have had since being in Thailand three years ago. I love that they have several vegan options! The staff is super lovely as well :) I highly recommend!

Ive missed Thai food so much since coming back to Canada, and their food was perfect! Friendly staff who speak English and Thai, and gave me a very accurate wait time estimate before taking my order when they were particularly busy, just to make sure I was okay to wait that long. Definitely coming back a lot!

Just noticed this place opened up on Burrard nearby! So glad I gave it a try and had take out. The pad Thai with crispy pork was flavorful and better than most pad Thais Ive had in the past few years. The Green Curry was also really good. Ill definitely be back to try more of the menu *Update* Still LOVE the food here. I also need to mention the amazing fried rice with Thai sausage (khao pad rood fai). I order it every time and its always the best!

Without a doubt, Unchai makes the best Thai food Ive had in Vancouver. Its the first time since visiting Thailand that Ive actually had good Thai food. I tried the Pad Thai with Crispy Pork and the papaya salad. Both were bursting with flavour and had just the right amount of heat. I will be back soon and cant wait to try the rest of the menu!

Way better than any of the other fancier Thai restaurants in Vancouver. Tiny, unassuming restaurant but they serve some mean, authentic Thai food! I love their shrimp Pad Thai, Tom Yum noodle soup (I wish theyd also offer just the soup without the noodles as an appetizer), and Ka Na Mu Grob (fried pork belly. Super tasty!!). I have been frequenting this place for almost two years and the quality of their food has always been top notch. If youre in the mood for Thai (and even if you are not), definitely give this restaurant a go. You wont be disappointed!
Best Thai food in Vancouver. When they took a month off to go see family and closed shop, I nearly died from withdrawals. Eat here if you want some authentic Thai flavor and quality eats.
Really great place, with great food and friendly customer service. Best Thai food restaurant I ve been to. Would definitely recommend to friends and colleagues.Try out the  pad se ew .
I missed Boat Noodles! It felt like I was in Thailand.

Great service. Amazing ingredients and skillful cooking. Brings me back to my Times in Thailand. They use real tamarind in the pad Thai and not tomato sauce. Simply the highest quality. Authentic flavor and great price.

Hands-down the best Thai restaurant in Vancouver. I should go back every week. Service super friendly. Limited items on the menu, as the chef has picked authentic Thai dishes, which sometimes include specials I have never seen outside of Thailand. Desserts are great too. Today, I had the roti with condensed milk: sounds simple, but was delicious.

Best Thai we ve tried in our neighbourhood. Fresh & fast! They accepted our take out order 15min before closing. Pad Thai & spicy fried rice flavourful without being heavy. We ll return to try more of their dishes

wow! what amazing food! I ordered Shrimp Pad thai (really, they used jumbo prawns! YUM) and green curry with Chicken. Pad Thai: Amazing layers of flavour... The sweet, citrusy, creamy, fresh combination is a delight on the palate. The Jumbo prawns were perfectly cooked. One of the best in the city. Thai green Curry: Flavours unfold slowly on the palate until you are hit by chili/pepper spices. The green curry is everything I expected: Creamy spicy,flavourful.... thank you for the real thai basil...what a difference. This is such a gem in the city (especially this part of the city). Happy to call you guys neighbours! cant wait to share this place with friends and family. Cheers!

Great quality, very fresh and flavorful dishes. The khao soi curry noodles and spicy shrimp salad, pad Thai exceeded our expectations. Its a small restaurant with small menu, but we enjoyed all the dishes we ordered, especially on this snowy day.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank so much :) we are happy that you enjoyed.

reviews.review_text: The best thai food in Vancouver!!! I am strongly recommend all people to come here to try the best authentic real Thai food. Thai food isn t about spicy, but it s all about good balance in all flavor, spicy, sour, salty and sweetness, and Unchai makes really awesome job. I am Thai and I can say this place is selling the real Thai food like Thailand!

Should try!! Great Thai foods in good location. Nice owners and great staffs. Ask for secret menu which doesn t show in menu;  Boat Noodle  & enjoy another simply well known authentic food in Thailand. If you in vancouver, put this restaurant in your list now ;)

I think if it s in-store I give it full marks for the taste! Got a tiny bit cold after delivery. Wings $9.99 - Love the taste of it. A little sweet and salty. Probably as crunchy as Phnom Penh. Curry Roti $5.99 - the roti is very crunchy although a bit hard. Wish it be crunchy on the layers it soft on the inside. Not sure if it s cuz it got cold. Chicken curry noodle $17.99 - Probably my favourite dish. The rich creamy curry sauce went so well with the egg noodle. The chicken was quite tender too. Pad si ew chicken $14.99 - The glass sheet noodles are so chewy and it s also very flavorful but not overpowered by MSG! Thai iced tea $3.99 - Can be a bit stronger with the tea base but I like how it s not overly sweet. Maybe cause the ice melted and diluted it a bit. This place would be crazy yummy if dine-in opens!
Their chicken pad Thai and pad Thai moo grob (pork) are our go to weekend take out meals. So consistently delicious and high quality food. Their place is always so busy which is great to see!

Great food! Fresh and authentic Thai food. High-end quality at affordable price. The venue is a small and simple, but the food packs a lot of flavour. Nice simple menu, done very well. New restaurant, worth checking out!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much. We hope to see you again soon :)

reviews.review_text: Amazing, its been a decade since I had something like true thai

We feel extremely lucky to have this authentic thai restaurant that just opened up literally down the street from where we live! The owners always greets us so warmly when we arrive. Since we knew of their existence, we couldnt stop ordering take out from them! Is once or even at times, twice a week, too much? Needless to say, they have hands down one of the best chicken wings I have ever eaten. Crispy, perfectly seasoned and the sauce that comes with it.....drooool...... great...now I want some. We have also tried their pad thai with shrimp! Delicious! I do prefer the shrimp pad thai over their crispy pork pad thai though. The other night, they had a daily special on their menu called Tom Zap, which is a hot and sour pork rib soup with a side of rice. I literally had tears in my eyes at the first sip. It was honestly so perfectly executed in the balance between sour and spice, plus, it was packed full of perfectly tender pork ribs that fell off the bone. If you happen to be in the neighbourhood, dont pass by this place without trying something on  their menu! Ask if they have any daily specials too :) Reasonably priced, great portion of food, wonderful service, authentic flavors, open until 10 PM everyday.
I love Thai food.

One of the yummiest Thai restaurant in Vancouver. The place is ran by a lovely couple. The husband was once a chef at a five- star hotels in Dubai. They serve authentic Thai food and dishes that are hard to find abroad. Try them out!

Now I had a chance to try everything on the menu (also stuff off menu), I can honestly say that everything is great. The attention to details plus chef s impeccable taste, on top of ~30 years of experience really shows. Every dish tastes different, and the flavour is just right, not too salty, not too sweet. Plus, people are super friendly. Bring your friend and family here or get some takeout, you will not regret it

One of the best Thai restaurant in lower mainland. I had soup and curry, and the fact that they make everything from scratch in house, it just bring up all the fresh flavor and make it super delicious. Will definitely go back
Go. Friendly owners that actually care about the food they put in front of you. Spectacular!

Best pad thai I ate in Vancouver. Tasty, great (and fast) service. I went there for my lunch break. Very popular place, so I would recommend going there early since there is not a lot of places but you can get your meal to go.

small unassuming neighborhood joint. Had the boat noodle and moon nam tok (pork jowl) for takeout, both had amazing textures and flavor profile. Highly recommended, among the best thai food in the city
Excellent curry and pad thai. Will revisit again.

Wow, we just got noodles, Pad Thai and Pad Si ew and an order of roti on the side. Everything was delicious, wonderfully flavoured, and well prepared. The roti was delicious, perhaps a little overdone, but brought me back the Malay street food. Will eat here again happily.
My favorite place to go for pad see yew.  Their noodles are a bit different than what  typical Thai restaurant would use.  A bit more chew but super delicious!  Would recommend this to everyone.

We just moved near this place. The food is absolutely amazing!! My husband is from Thailand so we know good Thai food and this place is it! Exactly like what you get in Thailand. Couldnt recommend this place more! Definitely a MUST TRY in Vancouver!
Delicious! Very friendly owner and authentic food. Very reasonable prices. They make their own curry pastes and you can tell by the flavours. Will definitely go back to try the other curries.
I ve had many meals here and they ve all been excellent. Possibly the best Thai food on the west side. Also good for takeout and delivery. Would definitely eat here again.

Husband and wife owned restaurant! Lovely and sweet couple that pays a great deal of attention to the flavor for each dish! ALL FRESH INGREDIENTS! I love everything here. This is my third time and I always look forward to the Ka Na Mu Grop (crispy pork belly with gai lan). You wont be disappointed here! If you havent visited, you are definitely missing out!
the best thai food i ve ever had
